name: Cashew Butter or Peanut Butter Chocolate Marble Cake. Vegan Gluten free Cake
description: Gluten-free Cashew Butter Chocolate Marble Cake Vegan Gluten free Cake. Peanut butter chocolate marble loaf. Soft, Moist, Delicious and Easy Gluten-free Marble Cake. Soy-free gum-free Recipe.  Makes One 8.5 by 4.5 inch loaf pan.
recipeIngredient: 1/2 cup white rice flour (, plus 1 tbsp)
1/3 cup smooth cashew butter or peanut butter (or other nut butter at room temperature)
3/4 cup non dairy milk (, room temperature)
1/2 cup sugar (, 2 tbsp more for sweeter)
1/2 tsp vinegar (use 1 tsp vinegar if omitting citric acid)
1 tbsp chia seeds or 1.5 tbsp flax seed meal

recipeInstructions.text: Prepare a heavy loaf pan (glass or stoneware) by lining with parchment. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. In a bowl, whisk 1/2 cup rice flour and rest of the dry ingredients and set aside. Add spices like 1/2 tsp cinnamon for additional flavor if you like.
recipeInstructions.name: Prepare a heavy loaf pan (glass or stoneware) by lining with parchment. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. In a bowl, whisk 1/2 cup rice flour and rest of the dry ingredients and set aside. Add spices like 1/2 tsp cinnamon for additional flavor if you like.

recipeInstructions.text: In another bowl, add all the wet ingredients and mix well. If they are not at room temperature, let the mixture sit for a few minutes to warm up, then whisk really well until the sugar and nut butter are well combined.
recipeInstructions.name: In another bowl, add all the wet ingredients and mix well. If they are not at room temperature, let the mixture sit for a few minutes to warm up, then whisk really well until the sugar and nut butter are well combined.

recipeInstructions.text: Combine the wet and the dry and whisk well to make a smooth batter. Transfer half of the mixture to another bowl.
recipeInstructions.name: Combine the wet and the dry and whisk well to make a smooth batter. Transfer half of the mixture to another bowl.

recipeInstructions.text: To one bowl, add cocoa powder and whisk in lightly to just about combine. You can also add 2-3 tbsp chocolate chips for additional chocolateyness.
recipeInstructions.name: To one bowl, add cocoa powder and whisk in lightly to just about combine. You can also add 2-3 tbsp chocolate chips for additional chocolateyness.

recipeInstructions.text: To the other bowl add 1 tbsp rice flour and whisk in lightly.
recipeInstructions.name: To the other bowl add 1 tbsp rice flour and whisk in lightly.

recipeInstructions.text: Add layers of the batters as you wish to the lined loaf pan (or add ladles of the batter and swirl lightly). I added nut butter layer, then chocolate and then nut butter. Sprinkle some chocolate chips on top.
recipeInstructions.name: Add layers of the batters as you wish to the lined loaf pan (or add ladles of the batter and swirl lightly). I added nut butter layer, then chocolate and then nut butter. Sprinkle some chocolate chips on top.

recipeInstructions.text: Bake for 40 to 45 minutes or until a toothpick from the center comes out clean. Cool for 5 minutes, then carefully lift from the pan. Do not let the cake sit in the hot pan for too long. Lightly cover with a kitchen towel or parchment and let it cool completely before slicing. Store on the counter for the day, refrigerated for upto a week. Warm to serve.
recipeInstructions.name: Bake for 40 to 45 minutes or until a toothpick from the center comes out clean. Cool for 5 minutes, then carefully lift from the pan. Do not let the cake sit in the hot pan for too long. Lightly cover with a kitchen towel or parchment and let it cool completely before slicing. Store on the counter for the day, refrigerated for upto a week. Warm to serve.
